recipes.name: Bourbon-Glazed Steak Tips
recipes.author: Jess Pryles

ingredients.item: Top Blade Roast, Flat Iron, or Sirloin

instructions: Cube beef into 1-inch pieces. Remove and discard membranes if using Top Blade Roast
Combine Worcestershire, soy sauce, vinegar, 1/4 cup honey, and 1/2 cup bourbon. Marinate beef overnight or minimum 4 hours
Heat cast iron skillet to medium-high; lightly oil surface
Drain excess marinade from beef and discard
Cook steak tips 5-7 minutes until browning develops
Mix remaining bourbon and honey; pour over tips to glaze. Cook until caramelized to rich brown. Taste and adjust salt if needed
Remove from heat; cool 2-3 minutes before serving

recipes.name: Monday Chicken Stir Fry
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large pan or wok over high heat
Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5-6 minutes
Add garlic and vegetables, stir fry for 4-5 minutes
Mix soy sauce with cornstarch and add to pan
Cook for 2 more minutes until sauce thickens
Serve over rice

recipes.name: Wednesday Pasta Marinara with Italian Sausage
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions
In a large pan, brown the sausage and break into pieces
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened
Add marinara sauce and Italian seasoning
Simmer for 10 minutes
Toss with cooked pasta
Top with Parmesan and fresh basil

recipes.name: Tuscan Sausage Pasta

ingredients.item: chicken broth or dry white wine

instructions: Boil salted water and cook pasta al dente per package directions
Remove sausages from casings and crumble into a skillet. Brown over medium-high heat for 5 minutes
Remove sausage; discard excess fat if needed
Add garlic, broth, mustard, flour, and lemon juice to the pan. Stir well, scraping up browned bits
Add sun-dried tomatoes and cream. Cook 2-3 minutes
Return sausage to pan and cook until sauce thickens
Stir in basil and spinach until wilted. Season with salt and pepper
Drain pasta and toss with sauce. Serve with parmesan

recipes.name: One Pot Skillet Ravioli Lasagna

ingredients.item: baby spinach and kale, roughly chopped

instructions: In a large oven-safe skillet, combine tomatoes, tomato sauce, basil, oregano, chicken stock, spinach, and kale. Bring to a boil
Reduce to a simmer and cook 5 minutes until greens wilt and liquid thickens
Stir in ravioli and add ricotta cheese in chunks. Return to a boil, cover, reduce heat, and simmer 7-10 minutes
Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Optional: broil 2-3 minutes
Let rest 2-3 minutes. Top with fresh basil

recipes.name: Marry Me Chicken
instructions: Pat chicken dry and season with 1 tsp salt. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate

Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Stir in cream, stock, bouillon, 1/4 cup Parmesan, sun-dried tomatoes, Italian seasoning, black pepper, red pepper flakes, and remaining salt. Whisk until smooth
Return chicken to skillet. Simmer over medium-low heat until internal temp reaches 165°F (8-10 minutes)
Top with remaining Parmesan and fresh basil. Serve over pasta or potatoes

recipes.name: Marry Me Chicken Tortellini

ingredients.item: sun-dried tomatoes in oil, finely chopped

instructions: Season chicken with salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and smoked paprika. Toss with flour
Heat butter and 1 tbsp olive oil in skillet. Cook chicken until browned and cooked through. Transfer to a plate
Add remaining olive oil, garlic, shallot, and sun-dried tomatoes. Sauté 3 minutes. Season with red pepper flakes. Stir in tomato paste and broth
Add tortellini; bring to a simmer. Cover and cook 3-4 minutes
Uncover and stir in cooked chicken, spinach, cream, and parmesan. Serve hot with fresh basil
